definition: spiritual leader (of a nation or church)/religious leader
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: Their spiritual leaders are called priests or ministers.
sentences.chinese: 他們的精神領袖被稱爲神父或牧師。

sentences.english: He is expected to be enthroned early next year as the spiritual leader of the Church of England.
sentences.chinese: 預計他將於明年年初登位，成爲英國國教的精神領袖。

sentences.english: Certain media call Lei Jun " mental cacique " leave.
sentences.chinese: 某些媒體稱雷軍爲“精神領袖”出走。

sentences.english: Ester was the spiritual centre of Wilson's Hill neighbourhood.
sentences.chinese: 埃斯特是威爾遜的希爾區社區中的精神領袖。

sentences.english: Let the spiritual leaders and enlightened individuals take a stand and express their hearts.
sentences.chinese: 讓精神領袖和開悟的個體表明態度，表達他們的想法。

definition: General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge

pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 He2 ping2 jiang3
